alert.note: Alert for Clay; Dickinson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 2:25PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Dickinson and southwestern Clay Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 225 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Abilene, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abilene, Manchester, Longford, Moonlight and Talmage. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 268 and 281. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
